snippet: The American International Group also reported it had cash it could use to buy down some of the remaining stake held by the federal government.
abstract: American International Group reports second-quarter profit of $2.33 billion, or $1.33 a share, up from $1.84 billion, or $1 a share, in the year-ago quarter; reports more than $11 billion in liquidity, cash it could use to buy down some of the remaining stake held by the federal government.
lead_paragraph: The American International Group also reported it had cash it could use to buy down some of the remaining stake held by the federal government.

headline.seo: Tax Benefits Help A.I.G. Post Increase in Profit
headline.main: Tax Benefits Help A.I.G. Post an Increase in Profit
headline.print_headline: Tax Benefits Help A.I.G. Post an Increase in Profit
